Reviews.Title: “Great Renovation”
Reviews.Author: bigmomma4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. Decor was tastefully done, room and bathroom were clean, and staff were courteous. Kids enjoyed pool and free cookies. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation complete, nice place”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatalie
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned based on the reviews about renovations, but assuming there wouldn't be any construction NYE weekend, we took a chance. I don't know how the place was before, but the renovations are quite nice. It's better than my previous experiences at Fairfield Inn. Pros: 1) Nice, modern lobby (though simple): Fireplace, seating, free cookies, coffee, ice water. Simple "market" of convenience store food and toiletry staples 2) A better continental breakfast: I had low expectations since it's continental breakfast, but they had apples, oranges, bananas, bagels, english muffins, hard boiled eggs, waffle batter and iron, cereals, granola, yogurt, coffee, juices, microwaveable Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, corn dogs (??) and an assortment of spreads—jelly, peanut butter, honey, cream cheese, etc. 3) Clean rooms with modern decor: Admittedly it's all done in my favorite color, green, but the rooms like very modern with simple lines, the beds were comfy, nice bathroom, etc. 4) Free wifi. You have to "sign in" but it's free for your entire stay. 5) Nice free toiletries--Pantene shampoo and conditioner, vaseline intensive care lotion, and they replenished it daily. Other notes: It's in the middle of retail/restaurant chain hell, which is great or not great depending on your point of view. There's a Target and a Wal-Mart very close by. We stayed here because it was easy access to head back East; it's a good 20 min from Beale Street. Cons: 1) Chintzy towels. Honestly it didn't fit with what they seemed to be doing overall with the place. 2) The one elevator seemed slow and was crazy hot; there were easily accessible stairs, though, and it's only 3 floors. All in all, it was a nice hotel for the money we paid and I was happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe they are booking anyone here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindadee
Reviews.Content: Do not......no matter what sort of 'bargain' rate you get, book here. There are probably 20 guys in, out, all around the building all the time. I cannot believe that Priceline ripped me off for 99 bucks a night in this place! Noise, mess, no privacy. I think that they should pay me to stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Major renovation- beware!”
Reviews.Author: CateMD
Reviews.Content: We are current guests having booked this hotel through Expedia. The hotel is undergoing MAJOR renovations and should not be occupied. There is no lobby at present- front desk staff are working out of a closet. We are here for a wedding and arrived with no choice. We were not given an option to stay at another Marriott and given no refund in part of the purchase. I can't even open the curtains as there is scaffolding outside my window. I expect much more from a Marriott property. I should have been informed there was this renovation going on and given the option to re-book. After a 50 min call to Expedia I have been offered a voucher for a future trip, but not even a partial refund from Marriott. There'd is dust and debris outside in the hallway- construction equipment everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when visiting Memphis”
Reviews.Author: beandipshell
Reviews.Content: On a summer road trip my husband and I traveled from Southern California to Graceland in Nashville, TN. This was our second hotel we stayed at and it was a good choice. It is so hard to find hotels when you are not from that area and unsure of where the good neighborhoods are. Upon reading reviews of other hotels downtown Nashville, we decided to stay here. It wasn't a long drive to Graceland, Sun Studios, or Beale Street, but it also inst right next door. Basically We were scared to stay downtown and the short drive was worth it to me. The hotel staff is so nice here. They had Ice Water and Coffee in the lobby and of course they offer breakfast in the morning which helps cut down on some of our expenses. There is a Steak and Shake in the same parking lot as the hotel which stays open late, so that was kind of a bonus! Overall the staff was friendly, the bed was ultra comfy, and the people that we met there were all really nice and friendly. I think we chose wisely by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best fairfield.”
Reviews.Author: Midnightneko
Reviews.Content: Me and my significant other stayed here 2 nights to get out of the house and have some quality time for our anniversary. The beds were very comfortable and the room seemed very clean, but this hotel must have been built on a very low budget. Conversations and other guests' televisions could be heard through the walls. We also heard 6 consecutive "creeks" every time somebody walked on the floor above us, which was very frequently, once a minute at least, even after we went to bed at 1am. It kept me awake. Every time there was a knock on a door in our hallway, it sounded just like our door was being knocked on; the walls were that thin. I had a few disappointments regarding breakfast. First of all, there is only one waffle maker. You have to stand in line and wait for each person to make their waffle(s). I made my waffle and then got a cup to get some apple juice, which was out. I found the lady in charge of breakfast and kindly let her know it was out. She went off to get more apple juice and came back and tried for 6+ minutes to connect the spout, and she was putting the container in there backwards in comparison to the other juice containers. I tried to point that out, but she didn't listen. I settled for water and went back to my room. My waffle was stone cold by the time I ate it, because of waiting for her. I went back down there a few minutes later to see if the apple juice was available yet, only to find out that she had put grapefruit juice in there instead where the apple juice should have been. The next morning, I tried the apple juice again, hoping that the problem had been fixed, but nothing came out at all, so I settled for water the second morning as well. Not a bad hotel for the price, considering the indoor pool and hot tub, which was very nice, but too many minor annoyances to want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shmarla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way from Texas to Viriginia. It was easy to find, close to some restaurants and across the street from the mall. It was an older Fairfield but it has been kept up pretty well. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The indoor pool was ok, a little chilly by Texas standards. The pool/hot tub area was a little run-down. It was in a safe area and we had no problems. There was plenty of variety at breakfast--just not a lot of seating. I thought it was priced a little higher than what it should have been but we would probably stay here again if passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest...”
Reviews.Author: uncmgrnds
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here over 4th of July weekend. This Fairfield looks like an old Country Inns & Suites. Not very clean, overall. In need of renovation. We had two adjoining rooms at end of hall. Our room just didn't have that "Fresh" feel while my Mom & daughter's room next to our's smelled. Lucky Mom always carries candles. I hate to be negative but I would not stay here again. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg30
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff was very very friendly. Close to everything .....I will continue to stay here when I visit Memphis

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at its Worst”
Reviews.Author: bgb67
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel and found the parking lot to be a bit dark. The front landscaping and hotel lobby are very outdated and could stand to be cleaned up. The lobby area floor needed mopped and had a stale smell. The front desk worker was not present at the desk at my arrival. Someone finally came from the tv room and checked me in. I was very disappointed in my room. The bathroom still had water marks around the sink, a couple of the towels had STAINS on them, and the bathroom floor had hair. This made me wonder if the room was adequately cleaned. I did notice a strong perfume odor as if they were trying to mask an odor. Furniture in the room was outdated and the remote to the television did not work. I have stayed at other Fairfields that were WAY BETTER. The breakfast was very average and the drink station was not clean. Housekeeping staff were a bit too loud in the hallways and at the front desk area.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: muffy4
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay. Good location near a shopping center and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean, and the desk staff were efficient at check-in and check-out. The breakfast was all right -- the typical continental breakfast offerings. The mattresses could have been firmer but were all right.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: oskacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over Spring Break. Although it is a little out of town, it is easily accessed off the I-40 and is located near a large number of shops (Wolfchase Mall), restaurants and a theater complex. Good rooms and indoor pool. Fairly limited breakfast. Overall a pleasant stay in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cndydvnprt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice the lobby was very clean and the staff was friendly. The check in/out process was easy. We needed a suite , there were 6 of us 3 kids and 3 adults. The suite was smaller then we expected but with a portacrib ( at no change) and a air mattress it worked. One of the TV's in the suite didn't work, they were not able to fit it so they reduced our room rate, They went out of thier way to make reservations at another Fairfield for us in different city. Overall the stay was wonderful, breakfast was nice, but needed more hot items and larger seating area. The kids LOVED the indoor pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: KChopin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three day stay at this hotel. It is a terrific location with Wolfe Chase Galleria, Germantown Parkway, and businesses along Hwy. 64. We stayed in a suite which provided adequate space to enjoy our stay. Several good restaurants were within walking distance. The hotel was clean and quiet. Manager and staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast far surpasses what other chains offer. Kudos to the Marriotts for providing a good hotel experience for a reasonable price. SML, Alabama

Reviews.Title: “You might want to pay cash”
Reviews.Author: KLBLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a week ago for two nights. It was clean and comfortable, but kids ran up and down the hallway into late in the evening, the neighbors were too loud, and the floors so thin that we had complaints from the people below us when we walked across the room. The worst part is, the had a new employee running the desk, who was very helpful and nice, nothing against her, but I have now been charged twice for our rooms and my father has also been charged ( we were traveling with my parents and he paid for the two rooms, while I made the reservation on my card). A week later, we are still waiting for a refund. I don't believe I will ever be returning to this hotel, or any of the Marriot family for the way they have handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Pooh27361
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while in the area on business. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bed was a little softer than I like but that's just me. The breakfast was probably a little better than most hotel continental breakfasts since they had Jimmie Dean heat and eat bacon, egg, and cheese biscuits available. The parking lot wasn't real big but there seemed to be enough spots for everyone without too much trouble. There were several restaurants close by and a Steak and Shake adjacent to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stay”
Reviews.Author: OhioTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way from Nashville to Memphis. Basically just slept here however, we found the room clean and nice. The area was very nice and quiet. Plenty of places to grab food or any thing that may have been forgotten. Perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Loved everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Isell4u
Reviews.Content: Being I stay in alot of hotels this is the best, I have ever stayed in. From the mangers to the housekeepers this hotel has got it going on. Free internet, great beds and homey atmosphere. I love this hotel and would reccomend it to anyone. I look forward to traveling to Memphis just to stay at this Fairfield

Reviews.Title: “Clean; Quiet; Good Rates;”
Reviews.Author: accent2
Reviews.Content: Lots of postive things, including the staff; BUT be alert for your personal security in the parking lot and the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: yellowpony
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean hotel for a low price! Free internet computer in lobby. Indoor pool was good. This hotel is about a 25 minute drive from downtown, so a car is a must. Close to a mall and many restaurants. I would recommend this hotel for a 1-2 day night, knowing that you have to drive to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the cold pool and dirty hottub”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel during a baseball tournament. I didnt mind paying higher for a hotel with a (heated)? pool and hottub. I booked the room for 2 nights. The first night we got to the hotel, we were tired after driving for 3 1/2 hours and was looking forward to the hottub to relax. The hottub had scum floating in it,bubbles, and a ring around the hottub like someone had just taken a bath. We all decided to swim instead. The water was cold like a cold bath. We told the front desk. The pool and hottub remained the same our entire stay. 24 hour coffee wasnt 24 hours either. The coffee was cold when we got there. Our arrival time was 6:30 pm. I think it was from breakfast. Positive....rooms were clean and people were nice who worked there. I wouldn't personally go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLGirl79
Reviews.Content: I will say that I didn't have the greatest expectations checking into this Fairfield. I expected a moderately priced hotel that was clean, and that was about it. Instead, I found a warm and welcoming hotel with a staff that was exceptional. From the front desk team to the staff that monitored the morning breakfast to the management, we found everyone to be friendly and courteous. The rooms were extremely clean, and the jacuzzi and swimming area was very well kept. The decor was cozy, and made our business stay much more personal than the average hotel. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Really Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a softball tournament. We had about 12 rooms in our group and I heard nothing but good things about teh place. Clean and nice indoor pool, breakfast in the morning was okay, nothing to write home about but as advertised, rooms were average to smallish but clean. Wireless internet..fast. Staff was very nice from check in to replacing a bathroom bilb, to allowing our team extra time in the pool, to giving us the breakfast room for dominoes and games. Very happy with the whole situation and would stay there again. Price was good for 75.00 and beds were made for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facilities and Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: cyberdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a business trip April 3, 2005. The facility is a converted Country Inn and Suites by Carlson. Nothing spectacular here, just good solid comfort and value. In the case of our suite, the surroundings were clean, well-appointed, and well-maintained. The indoor pool area is clean and inviting. I personally did not get a chance to sample the continental breakfast, but since everthing else was up the the Fairfield Inn version of Marriott standards, I presume breakfast offerings would be as well. The location here is worth noting. You're 18 miles east of downtown near a major suburban shopping mall. This means the hotel would normally be better suited to business travelers. For leisure travelers, you're a bit of a hike from such tourist attractions as Beale Street and Graceland. Still manageable, but not exactly "handy". Allow 20-30 minutes during non-rush hour times. However, a huge plus for business and leisure travellers alike is the proximity to a wide variety of shopping venues and the loads of dining options nearby. The entire area is something of a "restaurant row" with everything from fast food places, family restaurants, and upscale dining. Many familiar chain restaurants are represented, and there's pretty much something for every taste and price range. All in all, this is a good little hotel in a nice area.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Memphis East
HotelInfo.Address: 8489 Highway 64, Memphis, TN 38133
